clinical_study.brief_title: ThermaChoice III Under Local Sedation in the Office Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Using Gynecare Thermachoice III in the Office Setting Without Conscious Sedation

lead_sponsor.agency: Female Pelvic Medicine & Urogynecology Institute of Michigan

clinical_study.source: Female Pelvic Medicine & Urogynecology Institute of Michigan

brief_summary.textblock: Investigational study to determine if an endometrial ablation for heavy uterine bleeding, can be tolerated in the office setting without the use of intravenous medication.

detailed_description.textblock: A safe and effective treatment , called endometrial ablation, has been used in a hospital setting under general anesthesia for the treatment of heavy uterine bleeding. This study will evaluate if patients would tolerate the same procedure in an office setting using local anesthetics and common pain medication. This study will include twenty patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability of Uterine Ablation in the office setting

intervention.description: Uterine Ablation in the office setting to see if the procedure is tolerated w/o sedation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Heavy uterine bleeding
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uterine or cervical cancer
- Unable to tolerate office hysteroscopy
- Uterine fibroid tumors that distort endometrial cavity
- Uterine cavity greater than 12 cm
- Patients with hyperplasia or premalignant changes of the endometrium
- Active genital or urinary tract infections
- Intrauterine device
- Pregnant or want to become pregnant
